word_mean: 疹：由于疾病而出现的可以目击的皮疹性损害，特别是出疹性疾病时的潮红、隆起

sentence.Network_en: The temple was destroyed in the violent eruption of 1470 BC.
sentence.Network_cn: 庙宇在公元前1470年猛烈的火山爆发中摧毁了.

sentence.Network_en: The extinct volcano's eruption would mean a cataclysm for the city.
sentence.Network_cn: 死火山又重新喷发,对这座城市来说意味着大难临头.

sentence.Network_en: The place was recently visited by a serious volcanic eruption.
sentence.Network_cn: 这地方最近发生了一次严重的火山爆发.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin eruptio(n-), from the verb erumpere (see erupt)

entry.def: When a volcano erupts, it throws out a lot of hot, melted rock called lava, as well as ash and steam.

example.ex: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state...
example.tran: 那座火山在1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州大片地区。

example.ex: Scientists say Mount Pinatubo could erupt again soon.
example.tran: 科学家说皮纳图博山近期可能会再次喷发。

entry.tran: （冲突、战斗等）突然发生，爆发，突然加剧
entry.def: If violence or fighting erupts, it suddenly begins or gets worse in an unexpected, violent way.

example.ex: Heavy fighting erupted there today after a two-day ceasefire...
example.tran: 在停火两天后，今天那里爆发了激烈的战斗。

example.ex: Violence erupted as the boys were driven away in two police vans.
example.tran: 两辆警车将男孩们带走时突然发生了暴力冲突。

entry.tran: （某地）爆发动乱;（人群）突然暴怒，发生骚乱
entry.def: When people in a place suddenly become angry or violent, you can say that they erupt or that the place erupts .

example.ex: In Los Angeles, the neighborhood known as Watts erupted into riots...
example.tran: 在洛杉矶，一个叫做沃茨的街区爆发了动乱。

example.ex: This region which had been relatively calm erupted in violence again this spring.
example.tran: 已经相对平静的这个地区今年春天再次爆发暴力事件。

entry.tran: （感情）迸发，突然转变;（常指）变得狂躁
entry.def: You say that someone erupts when they suddenly have a change in mood, usually becoming quite noisy.

example.ex: Then, without warning, she erupts into laughter...
example.tran: 然后在没有任何征兆的情况下，她突然大笑起来。

example.ex: Newman fled barefoot as the cheated husband erupted in fury.
example.tran: 被戴绿帽的丈夫勃然大怒，纽曼吓得光着脚逃走了。

entry.def: If your skin erupts, sores or spots suddenly appear there.

example.ex: At the end of the second week, my skin erupted in pimples.
example.tran: 第二周周末，我的皮肤上突然出现了丘疹。

means.word_mean: 1. the sudden occurrence of a violent discharge of steam and volcanic material
2. symptom consisting of a breaking out and becoming visible
3. (of volcanos) pouring out fumes or lava (or a deposit so formed)
4. a sudden violent spontaneous occurrence (usually of some undesirable condition);
6. the emergence of a tooth as it breaks through the gum

auth_sentence.content: It had been devastated by a violent volcanic eruption.
auth_sentence.res_content: It had been devastated by a violent volcanic eruption.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It had been devastated by a violent volcanic eruption.

auth_sentence.content: It was the worst eruption in nearly a century.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was the worst eruption in nearly a century.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was the worst eruption in nearly a century.

auth_sentence.content: This eruption lasted two nights and two days without intermission.
auth_sentence.res_content: This eruption lasted two nights and two days without intermission.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This eruption lasted two nights and two days without intermission.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 突然的,出其不意的;[行为等]粗鲁无礼的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ab离开+rupt断裂→突然的[断开,离开]
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者
cor全部+rupt断→全部断→变坏的,腐败的
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者
corrupt[adj.腐败的;变环的]+ion表名词→n.腐化;腐坏;败坏
disrupt[v.使混乱,使崩溃,使分裂,使瓦解]+ion表名词→n.中断,分裂,瓦解,破坏
interrupt[v.中断,遮断,阻碍;打断[话],打扰]+ion表名词→n.中断,打断;障碍物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 破裂, 决裂, 敌对, 割裂
stems_affixes.word_buile: rupt断裂+ure→n.&v.破裂, 决裂, 敌对, 割裂
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使混乱,使崩溃,使分裂,使瓦解
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+rupt断裂→分开断→使崩溃,瓦解

stems_affixes.value_cn: 中断,遮断,阻碍;打断[话],打扰
stems_affixes.word_buile: inter在……中间+rupt断裂→讲话中间被打断

sentences.en: There have been several volcanic eruptions this year.
sentences.cn: 今年火山爆发了好几次。

sentences.en: The extinct volcano’s eruption would mean a cataclysm for the city.
sentences.cn: 死火山又重新喷发, 对这座城市来说意味着大难临头。
